snippet: The fund forecast that global growth to be 3.1 percent this year and rise to 3.4 percent in 2017....
abstract: International Monetary Fund warns government leaders sluggish global economy may fuel support for anti-trade policies, which in turn could stall growth; urges governments to invest in large infrastructure projects instead of relying so heavily on central bank actions, suggestion seemingly targeting Germany, which IMF has often rebuked for not helping to stimulate growth in Europe.
lead_paragraph: The fund forecast that global growth to be 3.1 percent this year and rise to 3.4 percent in 2017.

headline.main: I.M.F. Warns of Anti-Trade Sentiment Amid Weak Global Growth
headline.print_headline: I.M.F. Sounds Alarm Over Anti-Trade Sentiment Amid a Weak Global Economy
